sub_title: Senior Geophysicist at EBN: Energy Transition, Gas Exploration, CCS, Geothermal
summary:
My expertise is in seismic data processing and advanced imaging, but I am currently in a geophysicist role that also allows me to build on existing Petrel skills, structural and stratigraphic interpretation training, and on-the-job interpretation experience. 

This makes me an even broader geoscientist with a powerful integrated seismic skill set; data processing, depth imaging, inversion, interpretation. Knowledge of how a seismic volume is created is vital for successful interpretation and avoiding pitfalls. On the other hand, incorporating geological knowledge into imaging (QC) can "bridge the gap" between geophysics and geology. Passionate about working in multidisciplinary teams, I am focussed on sharing information within and between project teams, regions and disciplines.

- Conduct hands-on and in-house marine seismic pre- and post-migration (re-)processing and depth imaging work, i.e. velocity model building for VTI and TTI PreSDM migrations (Kirchhoff, Beam, WEM, RTM), for 2D and 3D datasets, for shallow and deep water environments, for different types of acquisition geometries.
- All aspects of processing project management.    
- Responsibilities include the definition of contract/tender technical specifications, the support of tender processes for seismic (re-)processing and imaging projects, project management of seismic processing contractors activities and to assure their services reflect contractual requirements. 
- Provide input to new seismic acquisition and processing planning and to the definition of imaging objectives, and to strategies surrounding relevant high-end seismic technologies.
- Responsible for ensuring that fit-for-purpose seismic processing and imaging activities are conducted with appropriate '100%'​ global QA and QC supervision and for coordinating Ecopetrol's subsurface staff input to seismic imaging projects.
- Technical and project management coaching, mentoring and training of junior team members. 
- Responsible for the communication to the subsurface team leaders, partners and local authorities of high level status of activities through meetings, reports, workshops, and conferences.
- Responsible for the definition and the pursue of the technical limit of current seismic datasets, maximizing the value and amount of information from legacy and new marine seismic data (re-)processing and imaging.", 'title': 'Marine Seismic Processing & Imaging Lead', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1468, 'name': 'Schlumberger GeoSolutions', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D560BAQFwhnoORL25KA/company-logo_400_400/0/1666604495973?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=pP6Tq624CyrMV2UgLuLQksil8jYV9BD60hdGBGQhgKQ', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/slbglobal/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'London, United Kingdom', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'SLB', 'description': "- Responsible for multi-disciplinary teams of 8 geophysicists running multicomponent (OBC), high-resolution geohazard imaging and converted-wave (PS) time and depth processing projects.
- Responsibility for management of project timelines and client communication.
- Close cooperation with in-house interpretation geophysicists (London) and the client's asset and geohazard team located in Trinidad and Houston, respectively.
- 50% Project Management and 50% high-end processing and velocity model building tasks
- Mentoring and training of junior staff, developing my teams, advocate knowledge sharing across geoscience disciplines and project teams.
- Presenting at PETEX, EAGE and SEG conferences and other events, obtaining show-rights from succesfull projects, see references below.
- Writing proposals, business plans, liaising with Sales & Marketing and R&D Teams.
- Ensuring image quality of all time and depth processing projects, completed on time and to the highest quality.", 'title': 'Group Leader/ Senior Geophysicist', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'London, UK', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'SLB', 'description': "- Depth Imaging project leader accountable for Schlumberger Geosolution's FWI projects
- Alpha & beta testing of FWI technology enhancements
- Running Kirchhoff PSDM and RTM migrations
- Development of bespoke FWI strategies, workflows, best-pratice documentation, and training material
- Integration with near-surface model building, surface-wave inversion, tomographic depth imaging, diving-wave tomography, and low-frequency model building for AVO.
- Focus on North Sea GeoMarket, West of Shetlands and offshore West Africa
- Collaborate with external clients and Houston FWI Center of Excelence 
- Train & mentor peers and junior geophysicists in FWI preprocessing & FWI project execution
- Provide FWI marketing material and aid sales strategy
- Internal and external presentations, see publications", 'title': 'Senior FWI Geophysicist', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'London, Houston', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'SLB', 'description': 'Joint Development Project between Schlumberger and Statoil with the aim to utilize full-waveform inversion to improve the imaging and mapping of complex Heimdal sandstone injectites, the primary reservoir target for the Mariner Petroleum Technology department. 

Statoil Management:  “We consider the Mariner FWI velocity model as a breakthrough in understanding the velocities in the area".

Outcome: 
- Enhanced PSDM imaging of the overburden & Heimdal Sandstones.
- Introduction of near-surface velocity anomalies associated with shallow sub-glacial ‘Tunnel Valley’ systems. High-resolution, accurate FWI Vp model down to reservoir.
- Improved seismic ties with key well markers.
- Optimized FWI workflow for shallow water, incl. QC procedures. 

Experience:
- Seismic re-processing and depth imaging of legacy ocean-bottom data over the Mariner core area. 
- Extensive literature research on sand injectites, the Mariner field and its regional geology, to understand the geophysical and geological challenges Statoil is (still) aiming to resolve.  
- Depth conversion and velocity modelling, using full-waveform inversion (FWI) and tomography.
- Seismic interpretation of Maureen Formation and Heimdal injectite sandstones, Top-Lista Formation, Balder Formation, Devonian Basement, erosional Chalk, overburden, etc..
- Creation and meticulous analysis (QC) of pre-stack and post-stack Kirchhoff and RTM PSDM data
- Well tie analysis as part of the validation of the produced velocity models.
- Key Technologies: Multi-component processing, Tomography, FWI, RTM, PSDM.
.- Software used: Omega In-house Processing software, Petrel
- Presented at PETEX, EAGE, SEG, see references.', 'title': 'Lead Geophysicist: Statoil Mariner Joint Development Project', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'London, United Kingdom', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'SLB', 'description': '- Developed a multi-disciplinary and multi-measurement approach in tackling the Sub-Basalt Exploration challenge
